intro: Dolomiaea platylepis, commonly known as the flat-leaved dolomiaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense heads. It thrives in dry, rocky environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Dolomiaea platylepis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and compact growth habit.
